description.narrative:
Insatsen avser ett projektstöd till Inter-Parliamentary Union om totalt 45MNSEK för att implementera det globala programmet "Strong democratic parliaments serving the people " under perioden 2019-2021.
Insatsen syftar till att främja och stärka parlamentens lagstiftande, granskande och representativa funktioner med fokus på mänskliga rättigheter, jämställdhet, ungas inflytande, konfliktförebyggande samt parlamentens ansvar och roll i att stödja arbetet för de Globala målen för hållbar utveckling.
Detta genom arbete mot 6 målområden: 1. Stärka parlament 2. Förespråka och främja jämställdhet 3. Förespråka och skydda mänskliga rättigheter 4. Bidra till fredsbyggande, konfliktförebyggande och mänsklig säkerhet 5. Bidra till unga människors representation och inflytande i parlament 6. Bygga parlamentariskt stöd för de globala utvecklingsmålen med särskilt fokus på hälsa och klimat
IPU’s totala organisationsbudget för projektperioden 2019-2021 är 454 MNSEK, av vilken IPU efterfrågar 45 MNSEK (9,9%) från Sida i programstöd. Den återstående delen planeras att täckas till största del av egna medel genererade från medlemsavgifter (ca 75%) men även med stöd från institutionella givare så som t.ex. Kina, Kanada samt från multinationella organisationer så som UNDP och WHO. Ansökan är en fortsättning på ett pågående programstöd, ”Promoting better parliaments for stronger democracies”, men med ökade satsningar på klimat och hälsa, ungdomars representation och inflytande, parlamentsledamöters mänskliga rättigheter samt IT-utvecklingen inom de parlamentariska institutionerna för ökad transparens. Stödet ska även gå till att vidareutveckla och stärka IPU's resultatstyrning.

Inter-Parliamentary Union has applied to Sida for funding of 45 million SEK to carry out the programme "Strong democratic parliaments serving the people " during the period 2019-2021.
The intervention aims to build strong, democratic parliaments at the service of the people for human rights, equality, peace and development through six strategic objectives, with a specific focus on ODA-eligible countries: - Build strong, democratic parliaments - Advance gender equality and respect for women’s rights - Protect and promote human rights - Contribute to peace-building conflict prevention and security - Promote youth empowerment - Mobilize parliaments around the global development agenda with a particular focus on health and climate
The intervention’s total budget is estimated to approximatley 454 million SEK, out of which the organisation’s own funding is approximately 338 million SEK and the remaining 116 million SEK is contributed by voluntary funding from Insitituinal donors, UN-agencies and civil society organisations.

The overall objective is to build strong, democratic parliaments at the service of the people for human rights, equality, peace and development. This by working towards the following 6 strategic objectives. Strategic Objective 5 (Promote inter-parliamentary dialogue and cooperation) and 8 (Bridge the democracy gap in international relations) are not included in Sida's program support. Strategic Objective 1: Build strong, democratic parliaments - Democracy and the rule of law are upheld with parliaments effectively exercising their role, in line with commonly developed standards on democratic parliaments and shared good practices.) Strategic Objective 2: Advance gender equality and respect for women’s rights - Men and women are equal in rights and in parliamentary decision-making through the action of gender sensitive parliaments Strategic Objective 3 Protect and promote human rights - Human rights, humanitarian and refugee laws are respected, and MPs are protected from human rights violations through the action of human rights sensitive parliaments. Strategic Objective 4: Contribute to peace-building, conflict prevention and security - Peace and security at national and international levels are strengthened through parliamentary dialogue, diplomacy and action towards implementation of international agreements Strategic Objective 6: Promote youth empowerment - Youth’s voice and views are heard and acted upon through enhanced participation and integration in parliamentary decision making. Strategic Objective 7: Mobilize parliaments around the global development agenda - The implementation of the global development agenda improves people’s lives and the planet, thanks to the progressive approach of Parliaments based on the SDGs framework, in particular in the area of access to health and in the fight against climate change.

tag.narrative: 13.2 - Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning.
13.2 - Integrera klimatåtgärder i politik, strategier och planering på nationell nivå.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

3.8 - Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection, access to quality essential health-care services and access to safe, effective, quality and affordable essential medicines and vaccines for all.

3.8 - Åstadkomma allmän hälso- och sjukvård för alla, som även skyddar mot ekonomisk risk, tillgång till grundläggande hälso- och sjukvård av god kvalitet liksom tillgång till säkra, effektiva och ekonomiskt överkomliga grundläggande läkemedel och vaccin av god kvalitet.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative: 2020 was a year marked by the pandemic, and IPU had to cope and adapt its activities to a new reality. Sida is still awaiting the formal reporting but during the annual donor meeting in November, IPU reported a few highlights from the year (see also minutes from the meeting in Dox for more information): The pandemic cost disruption to the work of the IPU, but the adaptation has been quick to implement, with many positive lessons learned in the way IPU does business. The pandemic brought challenges for the organization as an institution, but equally to its Members on how they function and deliver on the expectations of the people. IPU has managed to hold assemblies (which happen twice a year) virtually, but they have been held online and been extended over a period of six weeks, which causes a lot of work for the secretariat. As the crisis continues, it was imperative to pay particular attention to democratic processes and attempts to by-pass them in the name of the health emergency. IPU set-up a campaign to alert the global community of the dangers of adopting emergency measure that would overlook Parliaments and democratic functioning. The campaign gave a global picture of how parliaments were responding to the crisis, adapting their working method to the difficult and restricted work environment in place due to the pandemic. Evidence has been collected and is publicly available on IPU website on how Parliaments have been involved in the effort to manage and respond to the crisis. IPU’s response to the pandemic and adaptation had shifted some priorities, without rocking the fundamentals of the organization. Attention had been placed on how to help Parliaments manage their core business, looking at their IT facilities, the rules they are fashioning to allow them to function, with support from the Centre for Innovation to adapt. The IPU had not been able to hold both of its Assemblies planned in 2020 on account of the crisis, but the organization had managed to hold a virtual meeting of its governing bodies for business continuity, notably with a session of its Governing Council, the election of the new IPU President, and the adoption of the organization’s budget for 2021. For 2019, IPU reported a number of results which have previously been commented on (see statement on 2019 reports).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
